title: New report recommends Space Force change how it buys commercial satellite services
summary: The U.S. Space Force should overhaul its current approach to procuring commercial satellite communications services, a RAND Corp. report recommends.

title: NASA finally admits what everyone already knows: SLS is unaffordable
summary: "At current cost levels the SLS program is unsustainable."

title: South Africa joins China’s moon base project
summary: South Africa has formally joined the China-led ILRS project to establish a permanent moon base.

title: Relativity Space expands presence at NASA’s Stennis Space Center
summary: Launch vehicle company Relativity Space is growing its footprint at NASA’s Stennis Space Center in Mississippi by leasing an Apollo-era test stand to support development of its Terran R rocket.

title: Integrated resilient missile warning, tracking and defense
summary: The United States needs resilient space-based sensing capabilities for global detection, tracking and custody of advanced ballistic and hypersonic missile threats. These capabilities must integrate into the missile defense kill chain with existing space-based and terrestrial sensing, command and control, and effectors to enable early and effective engagement of these threats.

title: HyImpulse Qualifies Hybrid Rocket Motor for Flight
summary:
After its latest successful test campaign, HyImpulse has qualified its HyPLOX-75 hybird rocket motor for flight. The qualification of the motor brings the company one step closer to the maiden flight of its suborbital SR75 rocket. The single-stage suborbital rocket is powered by one of the company’s HyPLOX-75 hybrid rocket motors, which are capable of […]
The post HyImpulse Qualifies Hybrid Rocket Motor for Flight appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Redwire demonstrates bioprinting human tissue in space
summary: Redwire announced it successfully 3D-printed human tissue in microgravity, a step towards more ambitious biotech applications in space.

title: Terran Orbital announces plan to speed up satellite production
summary: Satellite manufacturer Terran Orbital in 2024 plans to accelerate production at its factory in California

title: Japan Launches X-Ray Telescope and Lunar Lander
summary: Weather finally cooperated and Japan’s space agency was able to launch its new x-ray telescope, XRISM, and lunar lander, SLIM. A lot is riding on both missions. The telescope is […]

title: Japan launches moon lander and X-ray observatory
summary: Japan sent a new X-ray space telescope into low Earth orbit and a first, small lunar lander on its way to the moon with a single launch late Wednesday.
